title: Mistakes in the exception messsages of `st.query_params`

labels.name: status:confirmed
labels.description: Bug has been confirmed by the Streamlit team

body:
### Checklist

- [X] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar issues.
- [X] I added a very descriptive title to this issue.
- [X] I have provided sufficient information below to help reproduce this issue.

### Summary

When accessing keys in `st.query_params` that don't exist, we show the following exceptions.

For `st.query_params.foo`:
![CleanShot 2025-01-04 at 02 52 29](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0f861c44-d4c9-49c5-addf-bea0b6529311)

For `st.query_params["foo"]`:
![CleanShot 2025-01-04 at 02 51 52](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b12f158c-05cf-4d2c-b425-31e76a8d9464)

There are 2 small mistakes here:

1. We should remove "Did you forget to initialize it?". That doesn't make a lot of sense for query params (I guess this was copied over from `st.session_state`). 
2. The first message should say "has no attribute" instead of "has no key". We also use that wording for `st.session_state` and `st.secrets`. 

(Btw, maybe it might make sense to generalize the implementation of all dict-like types, so we don't end up with all these subtle differences, see also #10107). 

### Reproducible Code Example

_No response_

_No response_

### Expected Behavior

_No response_

### Current Behavior

_No response_

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this used to work in a previous version.
